title: 'Are we entering a new era of eugenics in which people like me will be edited from the population?'
text:
Adam Pearson believes he would almost certainly have been locked up if he was alive in the first half of the last century. Born with an incurable genetic condition, the disability rights campaigner counts himself lucky that he arrived after the theory of eugenics - once remarkably popular within the British establishment - was scientifically discredited.

“I’d have been a goner,” the actor and television presenter says with a chuckle. “I’d have never seen outside a set of railings again. All the things I take for granted as a disabled man in 2019 - popping around the corner for milk, going to the pub, hanging out with non-disabled people, even being with a woman unsupervised - would just not be...
